cz.ive.evaltree
Class Expr<TYPE extends ValueHolderImpl,CHTYPE extends ValueHolderImpl>

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.messaging.SyncHook
      cz.ive.messaging.QueueHook
          cz.ive.evaltree.Expr<TYPE,CHTYPE>
Type Parameters:
TYPE - ValueHolder descendant used to keep expressions value
CHTYPE - ValueHolder descendant used to keep values of childrens
All Implemented Interfaces:
Hook, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Constant, DependentNode
public abstract class Expr<TYPE extends ValueHolderImpl,CHTYPE extends ValueHolderImpl>
extends QueueHook
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

Expression class
There are several types of expression trees in IVE used to evaluate fuzzy value expressions, integer expressions and IveObject expressions. This template and its descendant templates contains implementation of properities common to all types of trees. Value of expression is often changed. To prevent recomputation of whole tree because of minor leaf change lazy approach is used. Change spreads from the changed leaf to the root. Only parents that depend on changed children s value are recomputed (similar to C style of evaluating boolean expressions)

See Also:
Serialized Form

Field Detail

parents

protected java.util.ArrayList<DependentNode<? extends ValueHolderImpl,TYPE extends ValueHolderImpl>> parents
Container used to store parents - Expr descendant nodes, that has reference to this node and thus can register as listenner to this node.

value

protected TYPE extends ValueHolderImpl value
Actual value of expression This reference MUST be the same during whole Expr's life. (Parents has their own references to it) When you want to change value of Expr, don't create new ValueHolder instance. Call old ValueHolder instance's method setValue instead of it.

levelsOfDescendants

protected int levelsOfDescendants
Length of the longest path to some leaf It is zero for leaves.

dagIdentifier

protected int dagIdentifier
Each instance of ExprDAG has unique identifier. Value of this variable is set to id of DAG Expr instance is inserted in. Zero means, that Expr istn't in any DAG.

instanceNumber

public int instanceNumber
unique Expr identifier

Constructor Detail

Expr

public Expr()
In that case no queue is used to store change notifications and changed methods of registrted listenners are called immediately.

Method Detail

getValue

public TYPE getValue()
Get actual value of the node. It can be undetermined There are three ways how to make value actual -by construction of the tree -by calling DFSEval on the root node -by spreading messages from the leaves. Spreading of messages depends on the state of the tree ( whether it is inserted into some DAG or not)

Returns:
actual value

getType

public ValueType getType()
Returns value type

Returns:
value type

getNumberOfParents

public int getNumberOfParents()
Return the number of nodes that directly depends on the value of this node

Returns:
number of parents

addParent

public void addParent(DependentNode<? extends ValueHolderImpl,TYPE> p)
Add new parent. Parent is node whose value depends on the value of this node. This is used mainly during merging trees into DAG. This dependence is similar to the dependence described by node listenners but it is not influenced by current value

Parameters:
p - new parent

removeParent

public void removeParent(DependentNode<? extends ValueHolderImpl,TYPE> p)
Removes parent. Parent is node whose value depends on the value of this node. This is used mainly during merging trees into DAG. This dependence is similar to the dependence described by node listenners but it is not influenced by current value.

Parameters:
p - Parent to be removed

getParent

public DependentNode<? extends ValueHolderImpl,TYPE> getParent(int i)
Returns i-th parent of expression

Parameters:
i - index of desired parent (zero based)
Returns:
i-th parent ( or null if node has less than i parents)

getDagIdentifier

public int getDagIdentifier()
Each DAG has unique identifier. If the node is member of some DAG this method returns identifier of this DAG.

Returns:
if node is member of some DAG returns DAG identifier>0. Otherwise returns 0

setDagIdentifier

public void setDagIdentifier(int dagIdentifier)
Setter of DAG identifier

Parameters:
dagIdentifier - DAG identifier 0 stands for no DAG

getLevelsOfDescendants

public int getLevelsOfDescendants()
Return the size of the path from this node to the deepest leaf of its subtree

Returns:
size of the path

instantiate

public void instantiate(Substitution o,
                        java.util.List<Sensor> sensors)
Set references from LinkNode subexpressions to objects found in Substitution. Creates new ManagerOfSenses queries and links them to ManagerQuery subexpressions.
Only expression that isn't inserted in DAG yet can be instantiated. Expr just calls this method on all of it's children. If invoking of the method fails for some child, it returns fail (FuzzyOr has different implementation) If it fails for particular node its value is undetermined.

Parameters:
sensors - sensors that are passed to the manager of senses query that could appear somewhere in the tree
o - Substitution where link nodes search their targets

changeSensors

public void changeSensors(java.util.List<Sensor> sensors)
Change the sensors of already instantiated expression. It just passes the given list to all children.

Parameters:
sensors - sensors that are passed to the manager of senses query that could appear somewhere in the tree

uninstantiate

public abstract void uninstantiate()
Unbinds references to other parts of ive, such as attribute values. In contrary to instantiate this is not recursive and the invocation must be done on each node of the expression. ( because of DAG ) It should be used whenever you want to forget some tree

uninstantiateTree

public void uninstantiateTree()
Call uninstantiate on the node and whole subtree. This can not be used in case of DAG

remapChild

public abstract boolean remapChild(Expr<CHTYPE,? extends ValueHolderImpl> old,
                                   Expr<CHTYPE,? extends ValueHolderImpl> n)
Replaces old child by new one. Used during inserting tree into DAG when equivalent subexpression is found

Parameters:
old - old child
n - new child
Returns:
true on succes

getChild

public abstract Expr<CHTYPE,? extends ValueHolderImpl> getChild(int i)
Returns i-th child

Parameters:
i - zero based index of child
Returns:
child or null if expression has less than i children

getNumberOfChildren

public abstract int getNumberOfChildren()
Return the number of nodes whose values directly influence the value of this node.

Returns:
number of children

contentEquals

public abstract boolean contentEquals(java.lang.Object obj)
Similar to equals method of Object. Unfortunately we need to keep original functionality of equals method (Hook uses Hash)
The two evaltree nodes are considered to be equal if they are represented by the same class and if all references to other objects ( evaltree, sources, queries ) are the same.

Parameters:
obj - Object to compare
Returns:
true when obj is equal to this node in sense of this definition

contentHashCode

public abstract int contentHashCode()
Similar to hashCode method of Object. Unfortunately we need to keep original functionality of hashCode method (Hook uses Hash) The two evaltree nodes are considered to be equal if they are represented by the same class and if all references to other objects ( evaltree, sources, queries ) are the same.

Returns:
the same number for two nodes that are equal in the sense of this definition

DFSEval

public abstract void DFSEval(Substitution s,
                             java.util.List<Sensor> sensors)
Evaluates expression using Depth First Traversal (i.e evaluates subexpresions first) Used to evaluate uninstantiated expressions. It just asks to the needed values but it does not register to listen changes

Parameters:
sensors - sensors that are passed to the manager of senses query that could appear somewhere in the tree
s - substitution used to resolve uninstantiated links

createCopy

public Expr<TYPE,CHTYPE> createCopy()
Create copy of the expression. This can be invoked only on the expression that was never instantiated or inserted into DAG

Returns:
new expression

clone

protected Expr<TYPE,CHTYPE> clone()
Clonning is the first step of expression instantiation

Overrides:
clone in class java.lang.Object
Returns:
depth copy of expression.

refreshChildBindings

public void refreshChildBindings()
Create new child bindings. Before calling this only references given to node in constructor must be set. All other bindings will be created (registerListenner, references to children's value holders)

getInfo

public java.lang.String getInfo()
This is used by GUI to show the content of this node

Returns:
description string

getInfoArguments

public java.lang.String getInfoArguments()
This is used by getInfo to get arguments of this node

Returns:
arguments description
